title: Olympian Zeus, Temple of
content:
OLYMPIAN ZEUS, Temple of

Name given to the temple of Jerusalem by Antiochus Epiphanes in 168 BC when he turned the holy place into a shrine for the chief of the pagan gods of Greece (2 Macc 6:2). Jews were forced to abandon ancestral customs and could no longer observe Godâ€™s law. The desecration included temple prostitution, forced cannibalism, and humiliation for the Jews.
